#### The entity name

This is populated by the pipeline parameter but for testing can be entered manually here
entity_name = 'appeal-event'

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import json
from datetime import datetime, date
import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import display
import pprint
from pyspark.sql.types import *
pd.DataFrame.iteritems = pd.DataFrame.items
#### Create spark session and read the orchestration file and table definition from config

logInfo("Loading orchestration and definition from config")

spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

storage_account=mssparkutils.notebook.run('/utils/py_utils_get_storage_account')
harmonised_container = f"abfss://odw-harmonised@{storage_account}lib/"

path_to_orchestration_file = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_account+"orchestration/orchestration.json"
df = spark.read.option("multiline","true").json(path_to_orchestration_file)
definitions = json.loads(df.toJSON().first())['definitions']

definition = next((d for d in definitions if entity_name == d['Source_Filename_Start']), None)

if not definition:
    logError("No definition found")
    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(f"Definition not found for {entity_name}")
logInfo("Definition found")
pprint.pprint(definition)
#### Define variables for database, tables and keys

std_db = 'odw_standardised_db'
hrm_db = 'odw_harmonised_db'

std_table = definition['Standardised_Table_Name']
hrm_table = definition['Harmonised_Table_Name']

hrm_incremental_key = definition['Harmonised_Incremental_Key']
entity_primary_key = definition['Entity_Primary_Key']
#### Create Harmonised table if doesn't already exists
Import useful functions from another notebook
%run  /0-odw-source-to-raw/Fileshare/SAP_HR/py_0_source_to_raw_hr_functions
If the table doesn't exist it gets created based on the schema in the data model repo
#### Get the latest ingested data in Standardised

Get the latest data from the standardised table and create dataframes containing:

All of the data
Created messages
Updated messages
Deleted messages

And a further dataframe containing the harmonised data which is the target to be merged with

logInfo("Getting data from standardised")
latest_ingestion = spark.sql(f"SELECT * FROM {std_db}.{std_table} WHERE expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM {std_db}.{std_table}) ORDER BY message_enqueued_time_utc")

# remove the column ingested_datetime and then removing duplicates
latest_ingestion = latest_ingestion.toPandas()

if len(latest_ingestion) == 0:
    logError(f"Standardised data not available for {entity_name}")
    mssparkutils.notebook.exit(f"Standardised data not available for {entity_name}")

latest_ingestion = latest_ingestion.drop(columns=['ingested_datetime']).drop_duplicates()

create_df = latest_ingestion[latest_ingestion['message_type'] == 'Create']
update_df = latest_ingestion[latest_ingestion['message_type'].isin(['Update', 'Publish', 'Unpublish'])]
delete_df = latest_ingestion[latest_ingestion['message_type'] == 'Delete']

target_df = spark.sql(f"SELECT * FROM {hrm_db}.{hrm_table}").drop("input_file").toPandas()

if 'Std_To_Hrm_Mapping' in definition:
    mapping = definition['Std_To_Hrm_Mapping']
else:
    schema = mssparkutils.notebook.run('/py_get_schema_from_url', 30, {'entity_name': entity_name})
    schema = json.loads(schema)
    mapping = {field["name"]: field["name"] for field in schema["fields"]}

logInfo("Read data from standardised")
target_df.info()
Print counts of rows in each dataframe for reference

print(f"Latest ingestion: {len(latest_ingestion)}")
print(f"Create: {len(create_df)}")
print(f"Update: {len(update_df)}")
print(f"Delete: {len(delete_df)}")
print(f"Target: {len(target_df)}")
#### Utility functions

Functions to apply to the data:  
calculate_md5  
cast_dtypes - to cast columns as certain data types  
apply_mapping  
insert_rows_in_df
#### Handling new rows

new_rows_df = apply_mapping(create_df, target_df).drop_duplicates()

if len(new_rows_df) > 0:
    target_df = insert_rows_in_df(new_rows_df, target_df, hrm_incremental_key)

logInfo(f"New rows: {len(new_rows_df)}\nTarget dataframe: {len(target_df)}")
target_df.info()
#### Handling updated rows

updated_rows_df = apply_mapping(update_df, target_df)
if len(updated_rows_df) > 0:
    updated_rows_df = updated_rows_df.drop_duplicates().sort_values(by='IngestionDate')

    for index, row in updated_rows_df.iterrows():
        mask = (target_df['IsActive'] == 'Y') & (target_df[entity_primary_key] == row[entity_primary_key])
        target_df.loc[mask, 'IsActive'] = 'N'
        target_df.loc[mask, 'ValidTo'] = row['IngestionDate']
        target_df = insert_rows_in_df(pd.DataFrame([row]), target_df, hrm_incremental_key)

logInfo(f"Updated rows: {len(updated_rows_df)}\nTarget dataframe: {len(target_df)}")
updated_rows_df.info()
#### Handling deleted rows

deleted_rows_df = apply_mapping(delete_df, target_df)

if len(deleted_rows_df) > 0:
    for index, row in deleted_rows_df.iterrows():
        mask = (target_df['IsActive'] == 'Y') & (target_df[entity_primary_key] == row[entity_primary_key])
        target_df.loc[mask, 'IsActive'] = 'N'
        target_df.loc[mask, 'ValidTo'] = row['IngestionDate']

logInfo(f"Deleted rows: {len(deleted_rows_df)}\nTarget dataframe: {len(target_df)}")
deleted_rows_df.info()
#### Cast all columns as string data type to convert easily to spark dataframe
for column in target_df.columns:
target_df[column] = target_df[column].astype(str)
target_df.info()
#### Writing the dataframe to the harmonised table

# replace NaN with None
target_df.replace({pd.NA: None}, inplace=True)

# remove duplicates
target_df = target_df.drop_duplicates(subset=target_df.columns.difference([hrm_incremental_key]))

logInfo(f"target_df - de-duped: {len(target_df)} rows")

# overwrite onto existing harmonised table
new_df = spark.createDataFrame(target_df)
existing_df = spark.sql(f"SELECT * FROM {hrm_db}.{hrm_table}")

logInfo(f"Spark dataframe created with {new_df.count()} rows")

logInfo(f"Row count matches: {new_df.count() == len(target_df)}")

logInfo(f"Schemas match: {existing_df.schema == new_df.schema}")

# use the existing harmonised table dataframe to cast the data types of the columns in the spark dataframe so they match
for field in existing_df.schema.fields:
    column_name = field.name
    delta_data_type = field.dataType
    
    if column_name in new_df.columns:
        pandas_data_type = str(new_df.schema[column_name].dataType)
        if pandas_data_type != delta_data_type.simpleString():
            new_df = new_df.withColumn(column_name, new_df[column_name].cast(delta_data_type))

# load data to harmonised table
new_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").saveAsTable(f"{hrm_db}.{hrm_table}")

logInfo("Harmonised table updated")
display(new_df)
